{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontoblasts are cells that form dentin in a tooth. According to the documents, during the formation of dentin, odontoblasts move towards the center of the tooth, leaving behind an extension called the odontoblast process within the dentinal tubules. This process occurs during tooth development and dentinogenesis, not during cavity preparation, dehydration, or water irrigation.", "answer_choice": "D. None of the above"}
